definition: to become Emperor by the grace of Heaven/to "receive the Mandate of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
to go/to take/sentence-final interrogative particle/variant of 於|于[yu2]
the (rightful) emperor/"Son of Heaven" (traditional English translation)
official seal/imperial or royal seal/papal bull
first day of the first lunar month/(old) calendar promulgated by the first emperor of a dynasty
official name of a nation (includes dynastic names of China: 漢|汉[Han4], 唐[Tang2] etc)

Five Legendary Emperors, usually taken to be the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4] and four of his sons Zhuan Xu 顓頊|颛顼[Zhuan1 Xu1], Di Ku 帝嚳|帝喾[Di4 Ku4], Tang Yao 唐堯|唐尧[Tang2 Yao2], Yu Shun 虞舜[Yu2 Shun4]
interactions between heaven and mankind (Han Dynasty doctrine)
